Daniel McGinn

Mechanical Engineer

Learn More

Overview

Welcome to my website! I'm Dan McGinn, an avid adventurer and design enthusiast. I hold a B.S. & M.S. in Mechanical Engineering from Tufts University, specializing in Design for Emerging Markets and Robotics. Since 2018, I've been working at Dassault Systèmes SolidWorks, initially joining as a team member and later advancing to SolidWorks Product Manager. When I'm not immersed in the world of design, you'll find me outdoors, embarking on thrilling adventures with friends and family.

Portfolio

Product Manager for the SolidWorks Cloud Apps
2019-Present

My responsibilities include engaging with customers to understand their engineering workflows, leading R&D initiatives, and promoting the value of our apps to customers, resellers, and executives. I’m an expert designer with a strong understanding of engineering workflows. This rendering shows a 3D printer that I designed entirely with the SolidWorks Cloud Apps.

3D Models View 3D Printer with WebGL
3D Models Renderings & Screenshots of 3D Models

LEGO Robotics Design Project
2019

For two summers in college, I had the pleasure of working at the Tufts Center for Engineering Education & Outreach (CEEO). In 2019, I collaborated with LEGO Robotics to create a user-friendly web-based programming platform for students. The platform facilitated easy connection to LEGO EV3s and offered guided Python tutorials for seamless learning.

GitHub GitHub Repository
Screenshots Screenshots of the User Interface

Design for Emerging Markets
2018

For my senior design project, I designed a fatigue testing machine for an Indian company specializing in modular roofing tiles for village homes. Leading a team of five engineering students, I personally designed and fabricated the mechanical assembly. I traveled to Ahmedabad, India to install the machine prototype. For this accomplishment, I was honored with the prestigious 2018 James P. O'Leary Award, recognizing outstanding contributions in design by a senior engineering student at Tufts University.

EngineeringDrawings Engineering Drawings & Pictures
YouTube Fundraising Video

Medical Device Invention
2017

In college, I collaborated with a biomedical engineering student to invent a surgical device to improve ocular surgery. Recognizing an issue with the current medicine injection process for treating macular degeneration, I developed a new design that would stabilize pressure in the ocular cavity. We collaborated with the Tufts Office of Technology Transfer to file a patent.

Patent International Patent Application
Patent U.S. Patent Application

Adventurer
1996-Present

I enjoy being in the outdoors in my free time. During most of my college summers, I worked as a backpacking guide in the Rocky Mountains. Nowadays I spend a lot of time skiing and backpacking in the White Mountains. In this May 2022 snapshot, I kick off my ascent of Mt. Washington, gearing up to ski Tuckerman's Ravine—the birthplace of alpine skiing in the Northeast.
